definition: to bully intolerably (idiom)
to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
variant of 什[shen2]
what/very/extremely/any

sentences.english: Don't push me, or I will break your neck.
sentences.chinese: 别欺人太甚，否则我拧断你的脖子。

sentences.english: If you keep on pushing me too far, I'll quit.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再继续这样欺人太甚，我就退出。

sentences.english: Henry will resign in case you drive him too hard.
sentences.chinese: 如果你欺人太甚的话，亨利就会辞职不干。

sentences.english: Henry be to resign in case you drive he too exert.
sentences.chinese: 假如你欺人太甚的话，亨利就会辞职不干。

definition: to push sb too far/to go too far (in oppressing people)
how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to spit blood (idiom); venomous slander/malicious attacks
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
to refuse a toast only to be forced to drink a forfeit/fig. to hesitate to do sth until forced to do even more
pinyin: jing4 jiu3 bu4 chi1 chi1 fa2 jiu3

definition: to make false accusations against sb (idiom)
shameful/absolutely disgraceful!
if this can be tolerated, what cannot? (idiom)/enough is enough
pinyin: shi4 ke3 ren3 , shu2 bu4 ke3 ren3

definition: to act recklessly (idiom)
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
to have the impertinence/to have the cheek to
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
